revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=TP-LINK |model=RE210 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin=B00TQD2BYK |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=08/24/2015 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=Yes |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=now |type=range extender |fcc_id=TE7RE210 |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=100-240 |pwr_amp=0.3 |pwr_conn=AC (direct) |pwr_vac=true |pwr_ac_hz=50/60 |cpu1_brand=MediaTek |cpu1_model=MT7620A |cpu1_cspeed=580 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Winbond |fla1_model=W25Q64FVSIG |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Zentel |ram1_model=A3R12E40CBF-8E |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, |wi1_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip1_model=MT7620A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi2_chip1_model=MT7610EN |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=1 |wi2_rxchains=1 |wi2_sstreams=1 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Atheros |eth_chip2_model=AR8035-A |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags= |stock_boot=U-Boot;4.1.0.0;Ralink; |stock_os=Linux;2.6.36; |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=TP-LINK_Extender_2.4GHz,TP-LINK_Extender_5GHz, |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|AC750 Wireless Range Extender}} :[http://www.tp-link.com/lk/products/details/cat-10_RE210.html Product page] "2053500117" is silkscreened on the board in the [https://fccid.io/document.php?id=2721872 FCC photos]. :Hardware appears to be very similar to the [[Netgear EX6100]]. Unit has internal power supply and plugs directly into mains power socket. Stock firmware only functions as an extender and client bridge and does :not support access point mode. ===Basic details=== To get the unit open, remove the two screws at the top. Squeeze the case in the middle :of each side t help loosen the two clips that continue to hold it together. It takes some force to separate the two halves, but be careful not to damage the short :the antenna cables when the case finally gives. There is a ceramic heatsink on the CPU - you can remove this to inspect it by giving :it a twist. It will remain adhesive so can be re-attached when finished. ===Reviews=== *[http://geeklingo.net/tp-link-ac-750-wi-fi-range-extender-re210-reviewed/ ''TP-Link AC750 Wi-Fi Range Extender (RE210)'' on '''geeklingo'''] *[http://help-wifi.com/tp-link/obzor-tp-link-ac750-re210-dvuxdiapazonnyj-usilitel-wi-fi-seti/ ''TP-Link AC750 RE210 review'' on '''help-wifi'''] (RU) ===Serial=== ====Pinout==== *J1 is a serial header. Pin 1 is closest to the top :of the unit and pin 4 closest to the Ethernet port. The pinout is as follows: 
© 1 - Tx
© 2 - Rx
© 3 - Gnd
® 4 - Vcc
Connect with settings 57600 8N1. Signalling voltage is 3.3v. ====Console output==== {{SCollapse|Boot log |
